message_1:
A company wants to improve its website's performance and decides to conduct data mining. They collect data on the number of clicks per day for the past month. The company wants to find the mean number of clicks per day. The data is as follows:
15, 20, 22, 16, 18, 25, 21, 19, 24, 17, 14, 23, 20, 22, 27, 19, 18, 21, 26, 20, 16, 23, 22, 19, 21, 20, 24, 17, 18, 22

Calculate the mean number of clicks per day for the past month using data mining.
message_2:
To calculate the mean number of clicks per day, we need to add up all the clicks and divide by the number of days.

Mean = (Sum of clicks) / (Number of days)

Sum of clicks = 15 + 20 + 22 + 16 + 18 + 25 + 21 + 19 + 24 + 17 + 14 + 23 + 20 + 22 + 27 + 19 + 18 + 21 + 26 + 20 + 16 + 23 + 22 + 19 + 21 + 20 + 24 + 17 + 18 + 22 = 639

Number of days = 30

Mean = 639 / 30 = 21.3

The mean number of clicks per day for the past month is 21.3.
